src:
20 Resep makanan khas daerah, mudah dibuat
Masing-masing daerah memiliki keunggulan cita rasa yang berbeda dengan daerah lain.

06 Nov 2019, 02:01

Brilio.net - Indonesia terkenal sebagai negara yang kaya dengan berbagai potensi. Beragam kebudayaan, bahasa, suku, hingga kuliner tersebar di seluruh pelosok negeri. Dari Sabang hingga Merauke memiliki ciri khas tersendiri.
Bahkan bukan rahasia lagi, jika dahulu para penjajah begitu tergoda dengan Indonesia. Ragam rempah-rempah yang dimiliki Indonesia pun juga menjadi primadona yang diburu berbagai pihak. Tak heran jika rempah-rempah ini mampu menghasilkan beragam kelezatan makanan khas daerah.
Setiap daerah di Indonesia memiliki makanan khas yang kaya akan rasa. Meskipun terkadang memiliki nama yang hampir mirip, tetapi masing-masing daerah akan memiliki keunggulan cita rasa yang berbeda dengan daerah lain.
Sebagai contoh sederhana adalah Soto. Dari Barat hingga Timur Indonesia memiliki berbagai jenis makanan berkuah ini. Namun jika diamati, soto Padang dan coto Makassar akan memiliki perbedaan resep, rasa dan juga cara penyajian.
Nah itu hanya contoh kecil dari spesialnya makanan khas daerah. Penasaran bagaimana sebenarnya resep makanan khas daerah lainnya? Ini dia 20 resep makanan khas daerah seperti dirangkum brilio.net dari berbagai sumber pada Rabu (6/11).

1. Soto Padang



foto:Instagram/@arinda.z

Bahan :- 500 gram daging sapi (campur dengan tulang supaya kaldunya lebih kerasa).- 2 liter air.- minyak goreng untuk menumis.
Bahan cemplung :- 2 batang sereh digeprek.- 3 lembar daun salam.- 4 lembar daun jeruk.- 5 buah kapulaga.- 8 kelopak bunga lawang.- 5 buah cengkeh.- 4 cm kayu manis.- 2 batang daun bawang diiris.
Bumbu halus :- 10 siung bawang putih.- 6 buah bawang merah.- 3 ruas lengkuas.- 2 ruas jahe.- 1 ruas kunyi.- 1 sdt pala bubuk.- 1 sdm ketumbar bubuk.- 2 sdt lada bubuk.- garam.
Bumbu pelengkap :- sohun siram dengan air panas, rendam sebentar, angkat dan tiriskan.- perkedel kentang.- kerupuk merah.- sambal.- seledri diiris halus.- bawang goreng.- kecap.- cuka.
Cara memasak :a. Rebus daging sampai mendidih keluar buihnya, buah buih yang mengapung, masukkan semua bahan cemplung, lanjutkan merebus sampai daging empuk, masukan daun bawang, tunggu layu, matikan kompor, angkat daging, dan tunggu dingin.b. Panaskan minyak goreng, tumis bumbu halus sampai wangi, campur bumbu yang sudah ditumis ke dalam air rebusan daging, masak sebentar sampai bumbu dan kaldu menyatu. koreksi rasa.c. Iris tipis daging yang sudah direbus, kemudian goreng sampai garing.d. Tata sohun, daging didalam mangkok, siram dengan kuah soto, beri kerupuk, perkedel, seledri dan sambal.e. Sajikan.

2. Bubur Manado



foto: Instagram/@intankarinaijo

Bahan:- 200 gram beras.- 2 buah jagung manis dipipil.- 150 gram singkong potong dadu.- 100 gram ubi kuning, potong dadu .- 1 kg labu kuning, kukus dan lumatkan dengan garpu.- 4 liter air atau tambahkan sesuai kebutuhan.
Bahan sayur:- 5 lembar daun gedi,rajang halus .- 1 lembar daun kunyit,rajang sehalus mungkin.- 2 batang daun bawang, rajang halus.- 1 ikat kangkung, ambil daun dan pucuk mudanya, rajang kasar- 1 ikat kecil bayam, ambil daun.- 1 mangkuk kemangi, dari 5 ikat kecil kemangi, ambil daun dan pucuk mudanya saja.
Bumbu:- 5 batang serai, ambil bagian putihnya saja dan memarkan.- 2 lembar daun salam.- 1 sdm garam.- kaldu jamur secukupnya.- 6 bawang putih, cincang halus.- 6 bawang merah iris tipis.
Bumbu pelengkap- sambal dabu dabu atau sambal korek.- ikan asin goreng.
Cara memasak :a. Cuci bersih beras,lalu di panci masukkan air, beras, singkong, ubi masak dengan api kecil sampai singkong dan ubi lembut.b. Masukkan bawang putih, bawang merah, daun salam dan serai sambil terus diaduk, masukkan jagung dan labu kuning.c. Tambahkan air bila diperlukan, masukkan garam lada dan kaldu jamur aduk rata lagi.d. Setelah beras sudah menjadi bubur terakhir masukan semua sayuran aduk rata, koreksi rasa, angkat.
3. Sop KonroBahan :- 1 kg iga sapi.- 1700 ml air.- 1/2 butir kelapa parut kemudian disangrai hingga kering lalu dihaluskan.- 1 lembar daun salam.- 2 lembar daun jeruk.- 2 cm kayu manis.- Daun bawang dan Daun Seledri secukupnya.- Minyak secukupnya untuk menumis.- Gula pasir,garam,kaldu sapi bubuk secukupnya.
Bumbu halus :- 10 siung bawang merah.- 6 siung bawang putih.- 4 butir kemiri.- 1 buah kluwak.- 5 batang sereh.- Serimpang lengkuas.- 2 cm kunyit.- 1/2 sdt merica bubuk.- 1 sdt jinten bubuk.- 1 sdt ketumbar bubuk.- 1/4 pala bubuk.
Bahan pelengkap :- Nasi putih atau buras.- Bawang goreng.- Sambel & jeruk nipis.
Cara memasak :a. Presto iga sapi hingga empuk dengan air secukupnya,saring ambil kaldunya 1 liter.b. Pindahkan kepanci biasa,masukan iga dan kaldunya lalu tambah air biasa 700 ml atau secukupnya.c. Tumis bumbu halus dengan minyak secukupnya hingga wangi,lalu masukan kedalam panci iga,masukan juga daun salam,daun jeruk,kayu manis dan kelapa sangrai yang dihaluskan,aduk rata,beri gula garam dan kaldu sapi bubuk,didihkan cek rasa.d. Masukan potongan daun seledri dan daun bawang secukupnya didihkan sebentar matikan api.e. Sajikan dimangkok saji lalu taburi bawang goreng.

4. Sate lilit ayam khas Bali



foto: Instagram/@kitchenrina6

Bahan :- 300 gr daging ayam (giling).- 100 gr kelapa parut.- 1 butir telur ayam.- 2 sdm tapioka.- 5 siung bawang merah.- 4 siung bawang putih.- 3 biji kemiri (sangrai).- 1 cm kunyit (bakar).- 2 cm kencur.- 1 cm lengkuas.- 1 cm jahe.- 5 buah cabe rawit (boleh lebih).- 1 cm terasi (bakar).- secukupnya garam & merica.- 20 batang bambu atau serai.
Cara memasak :a. Haluskan bawang merah,bawang putih, kunyit, cabai, kemiri, jahe, kencur, lengkuas dan terasib. Campurkan ayam giling,telur,tapioka,dan kelapa. Beri garam dan merica secukupnya.c. Tumis bumbu halus hingga harum lalu campurkan kedalam adonan daging ayam. Aduk rata.d. Panaskan Grill Pan dengan api sedang. Ambil sedikit adonan. Masak hingga matang. Lalu cicipi rasanya hingga pas.e. Jika rasa sudah pas. Ambil adonan secukupnya dan lilitkan pada batang Bambu atau Batang serai. Lalu panggang di Grill Pan hingga matang.f. Untuk Sambal matah : iris bawang merah,daun jeruk,cabai,dan batang serai bagian putihnya saja. Beri sejumput garam. panaskan 2 sdm minyak masukkan terasi. goreng hingga terasi hancur bercampur minyak. lalu campurkan pada bahan irisan. Aduk rata, siap dihidangkan.

5. Candil ketan



foto: Instagram/@resepjajananpasar

Bahan :- 200 gr tepung ketan.- 30 g tepung tapioka. Tepung beras atau boleh tepung ketan saja.- 1/3 sdt garam.- secukupnya air hangat sampai adonan bisa dipulung.
Bahan kuah :- 150 gula merah, disisir.- 800 ml air.- 2 lembar daun pandan ditali simpul.
Bahan larutan pengental :- 1 sdm tepung ketan atau boleh lebih jika suka kuah yang kental.- 1 sdm tepung beras atau boleh lebih jika suka kuah yang kental.- Campur semua bahan dan tambahkan sedikit air, aduk hingga larut dan tidak ada yang bergerindil.
Bahan kuah santan :- 400 ml santan kental.- 1/4 sdt garam.- Secukupnya buah nangka dipotong kotak kecil2 ( opsional).Rebus kuah santan hingga mendidih bersama garam dan daun pandan. Matikan api. Masukan potongan nangka.
Cara memasak :a. Campur tepung ketan, tepung tapioka dan garam, tuangi air hangat secukupnya sampai adonan lembut dan enak buat dipulung ( kalau terlalu lembek boleh ditambahi tepung ketan lagi).b. Siapkan nampan, taburi tipis2 dengan tepung kanji.c. Ambil secuil adonan bentuk bulat sebesar kelereng. Susun di atas nampan. Lakukan sampai adonan habisd. Masak semua bahan kuah kuah gula merah hingga gula larut dan mendidih.e. Saring lalu masak lagi sampai mendidih.f. Masukkan bola bola ketan. Masak dengan api kecil hingga gula meresap dan warna bola bola ketan berubah kecoklatan.g. Masukkan larutan tepung , aduk pelan sampai kental dan meletup2.h. Jika kurang kental bisa ditambahkan tepung ketan/ tepung beras yang dicairkan lalu dimasak lagi sampai kental.i. Sajikan dengan kuah santan.
6. Pempek PalembangBahan untuk biang :- 400 ml air.- 200 gr terigu.- Secukupnya Garam dan gula.
Bahan untuk adonan pempek :- 3 butir telur dikocok (dicampur ke dalam adonan pempek).- 5 siung bawang putih dihaluskan.- 400 gr sagu tani.
Bahan untuk isian :- 2 butir telur dikocok beri garam, gula sedikit.
Cara memasak :a. Dalam panci campur terigu, air, garam dan gula. Aduk rata. Nyalakan api, masak sambil diaduk-aduk sampai menggumpal seperti bubur (hati-hati gosong) Angkat. Biarkan hangat.b. Pindahkan biang yang sudah tidak panas ke dalam baskom. Dalam keadaan hangat tambahkan bawang putih, telur kocok. Aduk rata pakai sendok kayu.c. Masukkan sagu sedikit-sedikit. Aduk rata.d. Balur tangan dengan sagu, ambil sebagian adonan bentuk silindere.Buat lubang dengan menggunakan jari telunjuk. Bentuk seperti contong kemudian isi dengan telur kocokf. Tutup adonan pempek rapat-rapat supaya tidak terbuka pada saat direbusg. Rebus pempek dalam air mendidih sampai matang, angkat.

7. Seblak Bandung



foto: Instagram/@umi_babyraj

Bahan:- 2 genggam kerupuk (redam di air biasa 2 jam).- 6 butir bakso.- 200 g ceker.
Bumbu halus:- 4 siung bawang merah.- 3 siung bawang putih.- 3 butir kemiri(boleh di kurangi klo ga suka creamy).- 1 ruas jari kencur.- 8 cabe merah keriting.- 6 cabe rawit pedas.- 5 cabe rawit hijau (untuk irisan).- Gula, garam, kaldu bubuk, lada bubuk.- 1 bonggol sawi sendok.- 1 batang daun bawang.- Air kaldubrebusan ceker (sesuai selera).- 2 butir telur yang sudah di orak arik.
Cara memasak :a. Tumis bumbu hingga matang.b. Tambahkan bakso, ceker, kerupuk yg sudah di rendam, garam, gula, lada, saus tiram, kaldu bubuk. Masak sebentar.c. Tambah air kaldu, masak hingga mendidih.d. Masukkan daun sawi, daun bawang, dan cabe rawit iris, masak hingga sayuran matang.

8. Batagor Bandung



foto: Instagram/@enegsari

Bahan:- 250 gr ikan fillet tenggiri buang kulitnya- 2 butir telur (jika besar boleh pakai 1 butir)- 5 sdm tepung tapioka/sagu- 2 sdm tepung terigu- 4 bh bawang putih potong goreng- 1/2 sdt meres garam- 1 sdt gula putih- 1/2 sdt lada putih bubuk (optional)- 1 lembar daun bawang iris tipis- 5 buah tahu pong segi4 bagi 2- 15 lembar kulit pangsit
Cara memasak :1. Masukan seluruh bahan kedalam chopper, blender hingga halus, koreksi rasa.2. Campurkan irisan daun bawang, aduk hingga rata.3. Isi tahu dengan 1 sdm adonan, isi kulit pangsit dengan 1sdt adonan, Goreng dalam api sedang hingga kecoklatan.
Sambal Batagor
- 100 gr kacang tanah- 6 bh cabai merah keriting- 6 bh cabai rawit merah galak- 3 bh bawang putih- 100 cc air putih- 1/2 sdt garam- 1 sdm gula merah
Cara memasak :1. Goreng seluruh bahan.2. Blender dengan air, garam, gula.3. Siapkan sedikit minyak, masak dalam api kecil hingga mengeluarkan minyak.

9. Tahu tek Surabaya



foto: Instagram/@dessivilast

Bahan :- Tahu putih- 2 Telor- 2 genggam kacang tanah goreng / -+100gr- 4 siung bw putih- Sedikit lada- Garam- Cabe rawit jika suka pedas- 1/2sdm petis udang- 1-2sdm kecap manis- Daun seledri iris tipis2- Kerupuk bawang yg biasanya juga untuk gado2- 2 genggam Toge rebus- Lontong atau nasi
Cara memasak :-Bumbu/saus kacanga. Goreng kacang tanah hingga matang, boleh digoreng bersama bawang putih dan cabe rawit, sisihkan.b. Jika sudah dingin blender semuanya ditambah air matang agar blender tidak berat jalannya.c. Tuang di mangkok, tambahkan gula, garam, kecap manis, dan petis udang.d. Aduk rata. Boleh ditambah kecap sampai dapat rasa dan warna saus yg diinginkan.
-Tahu telor:a. Kocok lepas telor.b. Masukkan tahu yg sdh diiris kotak2 kecil tambahkan garam, lada, dan sedikit kaldu bubuk.c. Goreng dengan wajan cekung dengan minyak yang panas dan api cenderung. kecil agar tahu matang sempurna.
-Plating:a. Iris lontong/nasi tata d piring, letakkan tahu telornya.b. Siram sausnya.c. Tambahkan toge dan terakhir irisan daun seledrinya.d. Tambahkan timun jika suka Jangan lupa kerupuknya.e. Sajikan selagi hangat.

10. Krengsengan koyo dan urat sapi khas Jawa Timur



foto: Instagram/@ocha_chupid

Bahan:- 300gr daging campur (koyor,urat,tetelan) rebus hingga empuk, potong-potong- 1buah bawang bombay,rajang- 1batang daun bawang,rajang
Bumbu:- 1sdm margarin- 2sdm baceman bawang- 1ruas kecil jahe,geprek- 1sdt lada hitam (pakai lada putih boleh)- 15cabe rawit (sesuai selera),rebus,lalu haluskan- 1sdm kecap inggris- 1sdt kecap asin- 4sdm kecap manis (sesuai selera)- 1sdt minyak wijen- Gula,garam,kaldu bubuk secukupnya
Cara memasak :a. Panaskan wajan,tumis baceman bawang bersama margarin,bawang bombay dan jahe hingga harumb. Beri air secukupnya,masukkan potongan daging yang telah direbusc. Masukkan ulekan cabe dan bumbui dengan kecap inggris,kecap asin,kecap manis,gula,garam,lada hitam dan juga kaldu bubuk aduk-aduk hingga ratad. Kecilkan api,tunggu hingga bumbu meresape. Terakhir koreksi rasa,taburi dengan irisan daun bawang dan juga minyak wijen,aduk sebentar lalu angkat dan sajikan bersama nasi panas

11. Rawon Surabaya



foto: Instagram/@dapurfoody

Bahan:- 500 gram daging sapi, bagian sandung lumur- Air untuk merebus daging- 1.500 ml air kaldu sapi- 3 sdm minyak goreng, untuk menumis- 1 sdm garam
Haluskan:- 6 siung bawang putih- 4 biji keluak (ambil isinya, lalu rendam dalam air)- 8 buah cabai merah- 2 ibu jari lengkuas- 3 cm kunyit- 2 cm kencur- 2 cm jahe- 2 sdm ketumbar- 1/4 sdt jintan- 1/2 sdt merica butir- 4 lembar daun salam- 2 batang serai, memarkan- 2 mata asam jawa, larutkan dengan 1 sdm air- 5 lembar daun jeruk purut
Pelengkap:- Tauge pendek/kecambah- Telur bebek asin- Sambal terasi- Kerupuk ikan
Cara memasak :a. Cuci daging sampai bersih, rebus sampai matang. Angkat dan tiriskan daging, lalu potong ukuran dadu. Sisihkan daging dan air kaldunya.b. Panaskan minyak, tumis bumbu halus sampai harum dan matang. Masukkan daging, serai, daun jeruk, air asam, dan garam. Aduk sampai rata dan beraroma.c. Pukul-pukul daging sampai melebar. Goreng dalam minyak panas sebentar, angkat. Taburi dengan bawang goreng

12. Gangan waluh basantan Kalimantan



foto: Instagram/@rinihasrita

Bahan :a. Waluh (labu kuning)b. Nangka mudac. Kacang panjangd. Santan (bagi 2 santan,e. Pisah antara perasan pertama, kedua dan ketigaf. Cekerg. Bawang merahh. bawang putihi. Serehf. Lengkuasg. Kunyith. Garami. Gulaj. Kaldu bubuk/penyedap (bisa diskip)
Langkaha. Bersihkan ceker, beri perasan jeruk nipis /asam jawa. Rebus hingga empuk lalu buang air dan siihkan.b. Rebus nangka muda hingga mendidih, buang airnya. sisihkan.c. Kemudian tambahkan santan perasan kedua dan ketiga. Masukkan waluh, irisan bawang merah, bawang putih, sereh geprek, kunyit geprek, lengkuas geprek. Biarkan hingga mendidih sambil sesekali di aduk.d. Masukkan santan kental dan ceker aduk-aduk.e. Kemudian, jika waluh sudah setengah empuk masukkan kacang panjang yang sudah dipotong-potong.f. Lalu masukkan garam, gula dan kaldu bubuk/penyedap rasa. Icip2 lalu matikan api.g. Gangan Waluh basantan siap dihidangkan.

13. Kikicak habang anum khas Banjar



foto: cookpad.com

Bahan inti atau unti :- 150 gr kelapa tidak terlalu tua atau muda, parut- 80 gr gula merah, sisir halus- 20 ml air- 1 lmbr daun pandan
Bahan kikicak :- 150 gr tepung ketan- 1 sdt garam- 50 gr tepung beras- 1 sdt air kapur sirih- 175 ml santan cair hangat- Sedikit minyak goreng- Secukupnya air untuk merebus- 1/2 daging buah naga merah, haluskan, saring, ambil airnya
Cara memasak :a. Siapkan bahan inti terlebih dahulub. Masukkan dalam panci atau wajan, air, gula merah dan daun pandan.c. Rebus sampai gula larut.d. Masukkan kelapa parut. Aduk rata hingga inti/unti masak dan mengering.e. Angkat. Sisihkan dahulu.f. Siapkan semua bahan kikicak.g. Haluskan daging buah naga merah, saring, ambil airnya saja. Sisihkan dahulu.h. Dalam baskom campur tepung ketan putih, tepung beras, garam dan air kapur sirih.i. Aduk rata.Tambahkan santan sedikit demi sedikit. Uleni sampai adonan kalisj. Tambahkan secukupnya air dari buah naga merah.k. Uleni hingga rata sampai dapat warna pink yang diinginkan.l. Beri sedikit minyak goreng.m. Uleni kembali sampai tercampur rata.n. Rebus air sampai mendidih.o. Sementara menunggu air mendidih, betuk adonan jadi bulatan bulatan kecil, pipihkan sedikit kemudian tekan sedikit bagian tengahnya dengan jariq. Masukkan kedalam rebusan air dan masak sampai adonan mengapung. Angkat. Tiriskan. Tata kikicak dan inti/unti dalam wadah saji. Sajikan.

14. Ayam goreng sasando khas Nusa Tenggara Timur



foto: cookpad.com

Bahan :- 1/2 ekor ayam, potong sesuai selera- 1 sdt air jeruk nipis- 1/2 sdt garamBahan ungkep:- 3 siung bawang putih- 1 cm kunyit- 1 cm jahe- 1 sdt bumbu masak bubuk- 1/2 sdt garam- 1/4 sdt gula pasir (bisa diskip)- 1/8 sdt bumbu penyedap masakan (bisa diskip)
Bahan saus:- 10 buah cabe merah- 5 buah cabe rawit- 1 cm kunyit, dihaluskan- 1 buah tomat, diiris- 1 cm lengkoas, digeprek- 1 sdt gula merah iris- 1 sdm santan kental- Secukupnya minyak untuk menggoreng ayam
Cara memasak :a. Balur ayam dengan air jeruk nipis dan garam, diamkan 10 menit lalu cuci bersih.b. Haluskan bumbu ungkep, lalu ungkep ayam dengan bumbu ungkep dan tambahkan dengan 400 ml air.c. Masak sampai airnya agak kering, matikan apid. Panaskan minyak lalu goreng ayam sampai kuning kecokelatan.e. Setelah matang, angkat dan tiriskanHaluskan bumbu ungkep kecuali santan, lengkoas, gula merah dan tomatf. Panaskan 3 sdm minyak, lalu masukkan bumbu saus yang sudah dihaluskan, aduk sebentar lalu masukkan santan, lengkoas dan gula merah iris.g. Masak terus sambil diaduk sampai airnya menyusut, matikan apih. Sajikan.

15. Ayam lodho khas Tulungagung



foto: Instagram/@kiky_meutia

Bahan :- 1 ekor ayam kampung panggang (ingkung)- 5 siung bawang putih- 8 siung bawang merah- 4 butir kemiri- 1 ruas kunyit- 1 ruas laos- 1/2 ruas jahe- 15-20 cabe rawit- Secukupnya ketumbar- Secukupnya garam- Secukupnya gula- 1 butir meggi block- 2 biji Santan kara- 1 serai- 4 daun jeruk- Air
Cara memasak :a. Cuci bersih ayam kampung panggang yang sudah dipotong-potongb. Haluskan bawang merah, bawang putih, kunyit, ketumbar, kemiri, cabe (5butir saja)c. Tumis bumbu yg sudah dihaluskan hingga wangi dan tambahkan serai, laos, jahe yg sudah digeprek, dan tambahkan daun jeruk serta cabed. Tambahkan air, meggi block tunggu hingga mendidih dan masukkan ayam, *air diusahakan menutupi hingga menutupi ayame.Tunggu hingga ayam empuk, kira kira hingga air menyusut setengah.f. Tambahkan garam,gula, penyedap dan santan.g. Siap disajikan.

16. Urap khas Lombok Timur



foto: cookpad.com

Bahan :- 1 ikat daun singkong- 5 biji kacang panjang- 1 genggam toge- 3 buah kecipir- 1/2 buah kelapa- 10 buah cabe rawit- 1 sdt Terasi bakar khas lombok- Jeruk purut diambil kulitnya- 2 siung bawang putih- Garam- Gula
Cara memasak :a. Rebus semua sayuran, sisihkanb. Bakar kelapa hingga kecoklatan dan mengeluarkan aromac. Untuk bumbu giling cabe, terasi, garam, gula hingga lembutd. Parut bawang putih, kulit jeruk purut, dan kelapa diatas bumbu kemudian aduk jd 1 dengan sayurane. Sertakan bawang goreng diatasnya jika ada

17. Nasi bakepor Kalimantan Timur



foto: Instagram/@yulianamenjoi

Bahan :- 300 gr beras putih, cuci bersih- 2 lembar daun salam- 1 lembar daun pandan, potong²- 4 sdm minyak sayur- 1 sdt garam- 400 ml air- 75 gr ikan asin gabus, goreng, lalu suwir - suwir- 15 lembar daun kemangi- 3 buah cabe rawit, iris bulat tipis1/2 buah jeruk nipis, ambil airnya
Sambal Raja :- 1 buah terong, potong dadu 1 cm- 10 lonjor kacang panjang, potong 2 cm- 10 siung bawang merah, belah 4
Bumbu halus :- 10 buah cabe rawit- 10 buah cabe merah besar, buang biji- 2 buah jeruk limau- 1 bks kecil terasi- 1 sdt garam- 1 sdm gula pasir
Cara memasak :a. Goreng ikan asin gabus. Angkat. Tiriskan. Suwir - suwir. Sisihkanb. Nasi Bakepor : Siapkan panci tebal. Masukkan ke dalamnya beras, air, minyak, daun salam, daun pandan, dan garam.c. Masak di atas api kecil sambil diaduk. Angkat.d. Masukkan daun kemangi, ikan asin suwir, cabai, dan air jeruk nipis, aduk rata.e. Tutup panci kemudian Masak dengan api sangat kecil hingga tanak dan nasi matang.f. Buka tutup panci biarkan hingga permukaan nasi tampak kering dan bagian pinggirnya berkerak. Matikan api.g. Sambal Raja : Goreng kacang panjang, terong dan bawang merah sebentar dengan minyak panas.Tiriskan.h. Ulek cabe rawit, cabe merah, terasi, garam dan gula pasir. Beri perasan jeruk limau. (Kulit jeruk jangan di buang, iris halus kulit jeruk).i. Tumis sambal hingga harum, masukkan kacang panjang, terong dan bawang merah yang telah di goreng tadi.j. Aduk rata sebelum di angkat masukkan irisan kulit jeruk limau. Aduk rata. Matikan api.k. Sambal Raja siap di dampingkan dengan nasi bakeporh. Penyajian : Hidangkan Nasi Bakepor hangat hangat dengan sambal Raja

18. Ikan kuah kuning khas Papua



foto: Cookpad.com

Bahan :- 500 gr ikan, potong-potong- 2 buah jeruk nipis- 2 lembar daun salam- 2 cm lengkuas, geprek- Secukupnya cabe rawit, biarkan utuh- 2 batang sereh, geprek- 2 buah tomat, potong2- 2 batang kemangi, siangi- 2 batang daun bawang, iris- 500 ml air- Secukupnya garam, gula, penyedap (optional)
Bumbu halus :- 8 butir bawang merah- 5 butir bawang putih- 3 cm kunyit- 3 cm jahe- 3 butir kemiri, sangrai- 3 buah cabe merah besar (optional)
Cara memasak :a. Ikan dicuci bersih, kucuri air jeruk nipis. Campur garam sedikit. Aduk rata. Diamkan 15 menit. Cuci bersih kembali.b. Tumis bumbu halus bersama sereh, lengkuas, dan daun salam, sampai harum.c. Masukkan ikan dan daun bawang, aduk rata.d. Tuangkan air. Tunggu sampai air mendidih. Masukkan garam, gula, dan penyedap. Aduk rata. Masak sampai ikan matang sempurna.e. Tambahkan perasan air jeruk nipis, cabe rawit, tomat, dan daun kemangi. Masak sebentar. Angkat.

19. Ayam baboto khas Papua



foto: Cookpad.com

Bahan :- 250 gram fillet ayam, dicincang halus- 3 siung bawang merah- 2 siung bawang putih- 1/2 sdt kenari yang sdh dihaluskan (bisa diganti dgn 1 buah kemiri sangrai dan haluskan)- 1 butir telur- 1 sdm santan kental- 1/2 sdt garam- 1/4 sdt lada halus- 1/4 sdt masako (bisa gak pakai)- 1/8 sdt pala bubuk- daun pisang secukupnya untuk membungkus adonan
Cara memasak :a. Campur semua bahan. aduk sampai tercampur rata.b. Bungkus dengan daun pisang. panaskan air kukusan sampai mendidih. lalu kukus selama 45 menit dengan api sedang. sebelah matang, tiriskan, Dan kemudian siap disantapc. Bisa di santap dengan emping dan sambal goang.
20. Papeda telor ayamBahan :- 1 butir telor ayam.- kaldu bubuk dan garam.- lada bubuk.- 5 sendok tepung sagu.- mentega untuk olesan teflon.- 5 tusukan sate.- 5 sendok sayur air.- bubuk boncabe jika suka/bisa skip .
Cara memasak :a. Kocok lepas telor dengan sedikit garam dan lada bubukb. Campur tepung, air dan garam, aduk-aduk bila terlalu kental bisa ditambah air lagi.c. Nyalakan api kecil dan taruh wajan teflon ukuran 23 cm di atasnya, oleskan mentega.d. Tuang setengah sendok sayur telor dan goyang sebentar agar telor tidak menggumpal.e. Tambahkan 1 sendok sayur adonan tepung, jika sudah agak mengering taburkan kaldu bubuk & cabe bubuk, langsung gulung dengan tusukan sate.f. Ulangi sampai adonan habis. Siap dihidangkan dengan cocolan saus atau mayonaise.

Reporter: Rizka Miftakhul

text:
20 Local food recipes, easy to make
Each region has a taste advantage that is different from other regions.

Nov 6 2019, 2:01

Brilio.net - Indonesia is famous as a country rich in various potentials. Various cultures, languages, tribes, to culinary spread throughout the country. From Sabang to Merauke it has its own characteristics.
It is not even a secret anymore, if in the past the invaders were so tempted by Indonesia. The variety of spices owned by Indonesia has also become a prima donna that is hunted by various parties. No wonder the spices are able to produce various delicacies of regional specialties.
Every region in Indonesia has special foods that are rich in flavor. Although sometimes it has a name that is almost similar, but each region will have a taste advantage that is different from other regions.
A simple example is Soto. From West to East Indonesia has various types of these foods. However, if observed, Soto Padang and Coto Makassar will have different recipes, flavors and also ways of serving.
Now that's just a small sample of the specialties of regional specialties. Curious as to how the actual recipes of other regional foods? Here it is, 20 local special food recipes such as summarized brilio.net from various sources on Wednesday (6/11).

1. Soto Padang



photo: Instagram/@arinda.z

Ingredients: - 500 grams of beef (mixed with bone so the broth is more tasted). - 2 liters of water. - cooking oil for sauteing.
Cemplung material: - 2 lemongrass stems crushed. - 3 bay leaves. - 4 orange leaves. - 5 cardamom pods. - 8 petals of star anise. - 5 cloves. - 4 cm cinnamon. - 2 sliced scallions.
Fine spices: - 10 cloves of garlic. - 6 red onions. - 3 galangal segments. - 2 ginger segments. - 1 segment of sound. - 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg. - 1 tablespoon coriander powder. - 2 teaspoons ground pepper. - Salt .
Complementary spices: - vermicelli flush with hot water, soak briefly, remove and drain.- potato cake.- red crackers.- sambal.- finely sliced celery.- fried onions.- soy sauce.- vinegar.
How to cook: a. Boil the meat until it boils out the foam, the froth is floating, put in all the ingredients, continue to boil until the meat is tender, add the leeks, wait withered, turn off the stove, remove the meat, and wait for it to cool. B. Heat cooking oil, saute the spices until fragrant, mix the spices that have been sauteed in the cooking water of the meat, cook briefly until the spices and broth combine. correction of taste.c. Thinly slice the meat that has been boiled, then fry until crisp. Tata vermicelli, meat in a bowl, flush with soup, give crackers, cakes, celery and chili sauce. Serve.

2. Manado porridge



photo: Instagram / @ intankarinaijo

Ingredients: - 200 grams of rice. - 2 pieces of sweet corn dipipil. - 150 grams of diced cassava. - 100 grams of yellow sweet potato, diced. - 1 kg of pumpkin, steamed and crushed with a fork. - 4 liters of water or add as needed .
Vegetable ingredients: - 5 pieces of gedi leaves, finely chopped. - 1 sheet of turmeric leaves, chopped as smooth as possible. - 2 stems of leeks, finely chopped. - 1 bunch of spinach, take the leaves and young shoots, coarse chopped- 1 bunch of spinach take the leaves. - 1 bowl of basil, from 5 small bunches of basil, take the leaves and shoot the young.
Spices: - 5 lemongrass stems, take only the white part and memarkan.- 2 bay leaves.- 1 tablespoon salt.- Mushroom broth to taste.- 6 garlic, finely chopped.- 6 thinly sliced shallots.
Complementary spices - dabu dabu sambal or lighter sambal. - fried salted fish.
How to cook: a. Wash the rice thoroughly, then in a saucepan add water, rice, cassava, cooked cassava over low heat until cassava and sweet potatoes. B. Enter the garlic, onion, bay leaves and lemongrass while continuing to stir, enter the corn and pumpkin.c. Add water if necessary, add the pepper salt and the mushroom broth to stir again.d. After the rice has become the last porridge, add all the vegetables to mix, taste correction, remove.
3. Konro Soup Ingredients: - 1 kg of beef ribs. - 1700 ml of water. - 1/2 grated coconut and then roasted until dry and then mashed. - 1 bay leaf. - 2 pieces of orange leaves. - 2 cm cinnamon. - Leaves onion and celery to taste. Oil enough to saute. Sand sugar, salt, beef broth to taste.
Fine spices: - 10 cloves of onion. - 6 cloves of garlic. - 4 grains of candlenut. - 1 fruit of kluwak. - 5 lemongrass stems. - Galangal galangal. - 2 cm turmeric. - 1/2 teaspoon ground pepper. - 1 teaspoon cumin powder. - 1 teaspoon coriander powder. - 1/4 nutmeg powder.
Complementary ingredients: - White or free-range rice. - Fried onions. - Sambal & lime.
How to cook: a. Presto the ribs until tender with enough water, strain and take the broth 1 liter. B. Transfer the regular pan, add the ribs and broth and add 700 ml of plain water or enough. C. Sauté the spices with enough oil until fragrant, then add to the rib pan, add also bay leaves, orange leaves, cinnamon and roasted coconut tossed, stir well, stir in salt sugar and powdered beef broth, boil the taste check.d. Put the pieces of celery and leeks to taste boil briefly turn off the heat. Serve in a serving bowl then sprinkle with fried onions.

4. Balinese chicken satay wrap



photo: Instagram / @ kitchenrina6

Ingredients: - 300 gr chicken meat (ground). - 100 gr grated coconut. - 1 chicken egg. - 2 tablespoons tapioca. - 5 cloves of onion. - 4 cloves of garlic.- 3 candlenut seeds (roasted) .- 1 cm turmeric (grilled). - 2 cm kencur. - 1 cm galangal. - 1 cm ginger. - 5 pieces of cayenne pepper (may be more). - 1 cm shrimp paste (grilled). - to taste salt & pepper. - 20 bamboo stems or lemongrass.
How to cook: a. Puree onion, garlic, turmeric, chili, hazelnut, ginger, kencur, galangal and terasib. Mix ground chicken, eggs, tapioca and coconut. Give salt and pepper to taste. C. Saute ground spices until fragrant then mix into chicken meat mixture. Stir well.d. Heat the Grill Pan on medium heat. Take a little batter. Cook until cooked. Then taste the taste until it fits. If the taste is right. Take the dough to taste and wrap it around a bamboo stick or lemongrass stick. Then bake in the Pan Grill until cooked. For Sambal matah: sliced shallots, lime leaves, chili, and lemongrass stems only. Give a pinch of salt. heat 2 tablespoons of oil enter shrimp paste. fry until the shrimp paste is crushed mixed with oil. then mix in the sliced ingredients. Mix well, ready to serve.

5. Candil sticky rice



photo: Instagram / @ resepjajananpasar

Ingredients: - 200 gr glutinous rice flour.- 30 g tapioca flour. Rice flour or just sticky rice flour.- 1/3 teaspoon salt.- sufficient warm water until the dough can be scavenged.
Ingredients: - 150 brown sugar, combed. - 800 ml of water. - 2 pieces of pandanus leaves are knotted.
Material thickening solution: - 1 tablespoon glutinous rice flour or may be more if you like a thick sauce. - 1 tablespoon of rice flour or may be more if you like a thick sauce. - Mix all ingredients and add a little water, stir until dissolved and no berindindil.
Ingredients coconut milk soup: - 400 ml thick coconut milk.- 1/4 teaspoon salt.- Sufficient jackfruit cut into small squares2 (optional). Boil coconut milk soup to boil with salt and pandan leaves. Turn off the heat. Put jackfruit pieces.
How to cook: a. Mix glutinous rice flour, tapioca flour and salt, pour enough warm water until the dough is soft and delicious to be scavenged (if it is too soft it may be added by glutinous rice flour again) .b. Prepare a tray, sprinkle thinly with starch. C. Take a slice of a round shape the size of a marble. Arrange on a tray. Do it until the batter runs out. Cook all the ingredients in the brown sugar soup until the sugar dissolves and boils. Strain then cook again until boiling. Add sticky rice balls. Cook on low heat until the sugar is absorbed and the color of the glutinous balls turns brown. Enter the flour solution, stir gently until thick and burst. H. If it isn't thick enough, you can add glutinous rice flour / thawed rice flour and then cook it again until thick. Serve with coconut milk sauce.
6. Pempek Palembang Ingredients for prickle: - 400 ml of water. - 200 grams of flour. - Inadequate Salt and sugar.
Ingredients for pempek dough: - 3 eggs beaten (mixed into pempek dough). - 5 cloves of crushed garlic.- 400 grams of farm sago.
Ingredients for stuffing: - 2 eggs beaten beaten with salt, a little sugar.
How to cook: a. In a pan mixed with flour, water, salt and sugar. Stir well. Turn on the fire, cook while stirring until lumpy like porridge (careful burning) Lift. Let it warm. Transfer the prickly heat to the basin. In warm conditions add garlic, beaten eggs. Mix well with wooden spoon.c. Add sago little by little. Stir well.d. Balur hands with sago, take some of the cylindrical shape dough. Make a hole using the index finger. Shape like a cone then fill with beaten eggs. Cover the pempek mixture tightly so that it does not open when boiling. Boil Pempek in boiling water until cooked, remove from heat.

7. Seblak Bandung



photo: Instagram / @ umi_babyraj

Ingredients: - 2 handfuls of crackers (muffled in plain water 2 hours). - 6 grains of meat. - 200 g of claw.
Smooth spices: - 4 cloves of onion. - 3 cloves of garlic. - 3 grains of candlenut (may be reduced if you do not like creamy). - 1 segment of kencur fingers. - 8 curly red chilies. - 6 spicy cayenne peppers. - 5 chilies green cayenne (for slices) .- Sugar, salt, powdered broth, ground pepper.- 1 tuber spoon mustard greens.- 1 stalk of onion.- Caldubebusan boiled water (according to taste) .- 2 eggs that have been scrambled.
How to cook: a. Saute the spices until cooked. B. Add meatballs, claw, soaked crackers, salt, sugar, pepper, oyster sauce, broth powder. Cook briefly. C. Add broth, cook until boiling. Add the mustard greens, leeks, and chopped cayenne pepper, cook until the vegetables are cooked.

8. Batagor Bandung



photo: Instagram / @ enegsari

Ingredients: - 250 gr mackerel fillet fish discard the skin - 2 eggs (if large can use 1 item) - 5 tablespoons tapioca flour / sago - 2 tablespoons wheat flour - 4 pcs of fried cut garlic - 1/2 tsp resize salt - 1 tsp white sugar - 1/2 tspground white pepper (optional) - 1 sheet thinly sliced scallion - 5 pieces of tofu in terms of squares4 for 2- 15 pieces of dumpling skin
How to cook: 1. Put all ingredients into the chopper, blender until smooth, taste correction. Mix the sliced green onion, stir until smooth. Fill tofu with 1 tablespoon of dough, fill dumpling skin with 1sdt of dough, Fry in medium heat until browned.
Sambal Batagor
- 100 gr groundnut - 6 pcs curly red chili - 6 pcs fermented red cayenne pepper - 3 pcs garlic - 100 cc white water - 1/2 tsp salt - 1 tbsp brown sugar
How to cook: 1. Fry all ingredients.2. Blender with water, salt, sugar.3. Prepare a little oil, cook on low heat until removing the oil.

9. Know tech Surabaya



photo: Instagram / @ dessivilast

Ingredients: - White tofu - 2 Eggs - 2 handfuls of fried peanuts / - + 100gr - 4 cloves bw white - A little pepper - Salt - Chili if you like it spicy - 1 / 2sdm shrimp paste - 1-2sdm sweet soy sauce - Sliced celery leaves thin2- Onion crackers which are usually also for gado2- 2 handfuls of boiled Toge-Lontong or rice
How to cook: - Seasoning / Kacang sauce. Fried peanuts until cooked, may be fried with garlic and cayenne pepper, set aside.b. If it has cooled all of the blender, add boiled water so that the blender is not heavy. C. Pour into a bowl, add sugar, salt, soy sauce, and shrimp paste. Stir well. May add soy sauce until you can taste and color the desired sauce.
-Own eggs: a. Shake off the egg. B. Enter the tofu that has been sliced into small squares, add salt, pepper, and a little broth. C. Fry it with a concave pan with hot oil and tend fire. small so that the ripe tofu is perfect.
-Plating: a. Slice lontong / nasi Tata d dishes, place the egg tofu.b. Flush the sauce.c. Add bean sprouts and finally sliced celery leaves.d. Add cucumber if you like it Don't forget the crackers. Serve while warm.

10. Krengsengan patch and veins typical of East Java



photo: Instagram / @ ocha_chupid

Ingredients: - 300gr mixed meat (patchy, veined, tetelan) boiled until tender, cut into pieces - 1 piece of onion, chopped - 1 stalk of onion, chopped
Spices: - 1sdm margarine - 2sdm baceman onion - 1 small section of ginger, geprek - 1sdt black pepper (use white pepper may) - 15cabe of cayenne (according to taste), boiled, then puree - 1sdm English soy sauce - 1sdt soy sauce - 4sdm sweet soy sauce (use white pepper may) - 15cabe cayenne (according to taste), boiled, then puree - 1sdm English soy sauce - 1sdt soy sauce - 4sdm sweet soy sauce (use white pepper may) according to taste) - 1sdt sesame oil - Sugar, salt, broth powder to taste
How to cook: a. Heat a frying pan, saute baceman onion with margarine, onion and ginger until the harumb. Give enough water, add pieces of meat that has been boiled c. Add the chili pepper paste and season with English soy sauce, soy sauce, sweet soy sauce, sugar, salt, black pepper and also broth powder stirring until ratad. Reduce the heat, wait for the seasoning to taste. Finally, correct the flavor, sprinkle with sliced scallions and sesame oil, stir briefly then remove and serve with hot rice

11. Rawon Surabaya



photo: Instagram / @ kitchenfoody

Ingredients: - 500 grams of beef, part of the battered broth - Water for boiling meat - 1,500 ml of beef broth water - 3 tablespoons of cooking oil, for sauteing - 1 tablespoon of salt
Puree: - 6 cloves of garlic - 4 seedlings (take the contents, then soak in water) - 8 red chilies - 2 thumbs galangal - 3 cm turmeric - 2 cm kencur - 2 cm ginger - 2 tablespoons coriander - 1/4 teaspoon cumin - 1/2 teaspoon pepper grains - 4 bay leaves - 2 lemongrass stems, memarkan - 2 tamarind eyes, dissolve with 1 tablespoon of water - 5 sheets of kaffir lime leaves
Complement: - Short bean sprouts / Sprouts - Salted duck eggs - Shrimp paste - Fish crackers
How to cook: a. Wash the meat thoroughly, boil until cooked. Remove and drain the meat, then cut into cubes. Set aside meat and broth. B. Heat the oil, saute the spices until fragrant and cooked. Add meat, lemongrass, orange leaves, tamarind water and salt. Stir until smooth and flavorful. C. Beat the meat until wide. Fry in hot oil briefly, remove from heat. Sprinkle with fried onions

12. Gangan walantan Kalimantan basantan



photo: Instagram / @ rinihasrita

Material: a. Waluh (pumpkin) b. Jackfruit mudac. Long beans and Santan (for 2 coconut milk, e. Separate between the first, second and third squeeze. Checks. Shallots. Garlic. Serehf. Galangal. Turmeric. Garami. Gulaj. Powder / flavor broth (can be dissipated)
Step. Clean the claw, give the lime juice / tamarind. Boil until tender then defecate and set aside.b. Boil young jackfruit until boiling, pee. set aside.c. Then add the second and third squeeze coconut milk. Add the pumpkin, sliced shallots, garlic, lemongrass geprek, turmeric geprek, galangal geprek. Let it boil while stirring occasionally. Add thick coconut milk and stir stir. Then, if the pumpkin is half tender enter the long beans that have been cut into pieces. Then add salt, sugar and powder / flavoring broth. Icip2 then turn off the flame. Gangan Waluh Basantan is ready to be served.

13. Kikicak habang anum typical of Banjar



photo: cookpad.com

Core material or unti: - 150 gr coconut not too old or young, grated - 80 g brown sugar, fine comb - 20 ml water - 1 lmbr pandan leaves
Kikicak ingredients: - 150 gr sticky rice flour - 1 tsp salt - 50 gr rice flour - 1 tsp water whiting - 175 ml warm liquid coconut milk - A little cooking oil - Enough water to boil- 1/2 red dragon fruit meat, puree, strain , take the water
How to cook: a. Prepare the core material first. Enter in a pan or pan, water, brown sugar and pandan leaves.c. Boil until the sugar dissolves. Add grated coconut. Mix well until the core / stove cooks and dries. Lift. Set aside first. Prepare all kikicak ingredients. Blend the red dragon fruit meat, strain it, just take the water. Set aside first. In a basin mixed with white sticky rice flour, rice flour, salt and whiting. Mix well. Add coconut milk little by little. Knead until kalisj mixture. Add enough water from the red dragon fruit. K. Knead until smooth until you get the desired pink color. Give a little cooking oil. Knead again until thoroughly blended. Boil water until boiling. While waiting for the water to boil, bend the dough into a small sphere, flatten it a little and then press it slightly in the middle with your fingers. Enter into boiling water and cook until the dough floats. Lift. Drain well. Tata kikicak and core / unti in a food container. Serve.

14. Sasando fried chicken typical of East Nusa Tenggara



photo: cookpad.com

Ingredients: - 1/2 chicken, cut according to taste - 1 teaspoon lime juice - 1/2 teaspoon salt Leaves: - 3 cloves of garlic - 1 cm turmeric - 1 cm ginger - 1 teaspoon seasoning powder - 1/2 teaspoon salt - 1/4 teaspoon granulated sugar (can be dissipated) - 1/8 teaspoon seasoning (can be dissipated)
Ingredients: - 10 red chilies - 5 cayenne peppers - 1 cm turmeric, mashed - 1 tomato, sliced - 1 cm lancoas, crushed - 1 teaspoon sliced brown sugar - 1 tablespoon thick coconut milk - Enough oil for frying chicken
How to cook: a. Balat chicken with lime juice and salt, let stand 10 minutes then wash thoroughly. B. Blend the marinade seasoning, then chicken the marinade with the marinade seasoning and add 400 ml of water. Cook until the water is rather dry, turn off the apid. Heat the oil and fry the chicken until browned yellow. Once cooked, remove from heat and drain. Smooth the spice seasoning except coconut milk, galangal, brown sugar and tomatoes. Heat 3 tablespoons of oil, then add the seasoning sauce that has been mashed, stir briefly and then add coconut milk, galangal and sliced brown sugar. Keep cooking while stirring until the water has shrunk, turn it off. Serve.

15. Tulungagung Lodho Chicken



photo: Instagram / @ kiky_meutia

Ingredients: - 1 roasted native chicken (ingkung) - 5 cloves of garlic - 8 cloves of onion - 4 grains of kemiri - 1 segment of turmeric - 1 segment of laos - 1/2 segment of ginger - 15-20 cayenne pepper - To taste coriander - To taste salt - Inadequate sugar - 1 meggi block - 2 seeds Santan kara - 1 lemongrass - 4 orange leaves - Water
How to cook: a. Wash clean grilled chicken that has been cut into pieces. Puree onion, garlic, turmeric, coriander, hazelnut, chili (5 grains only) c. Sauté the seasoning that has been mashed until fragrant and add the lemongrass, laos, ginger which has been crushed, and add the orange leaves and cabed. Add water, meggi block, wait until it boils and add the chicken, * try to cover the water until it covers the ayame. Wait until the chicken is tender, approximately until the water shrinks in half. F. Add salt, sugar, flavoring and coconut milk.g. Ready to be served.

16. An ointment typical of East Lombok



photo: cookpad.com

Ingredients: - 1 bunch of cassava leaves - 5 long bean seeds - 1 handful of bean sprouts - 3 pieces of winged fruit - 1/2 coconut fruit - 10 pieces of cayenne pepper - 1 tsp Special grilled shrimp paste - Kaffir lime extracted - 2 cloves of garlic - Salt - sugar
How to cook: a. Boil all vegetables, set aside. Burn coconut until brown and release aromac. For ground chili, shrimp paste, salt, sugar until soft. Grate the garlic, kaffir lime skin, and coconut on top of the seasoning then stir it into 1 with vegetables. Include fried onions on top if any

17. East Kalimantan bakepor rice



photo: Instagram / @ yulianamenjoi

Ingredients: - 300 gr white rice, wash thoroughly - 2 bay leaves - 1 sheet of pandan leaves, cut ² - 4 tablespoons vegetable oil - 1 tsp salt - 400 ml water - 75 g salted fish cork, fry, then shred - shred - 15 basil leaves - 3 pieces of cayenne pepper, thinly sliced round 1/2 fruit of lime, take the water
Sambal Raja: - 1 eggplant, diced 1 cm - 10 long bean sprouts, cut 2 cm - 10 cloves of onion, split 4
Smooth spices: - 10 pieces of cayenne pepper - 10 large red chilies, seeds removed - 2 limes - 1 small batch of shrimp paste - 1 teaspoon salt - 1 tablespoon sugar
How to cook: a. Fried cork salted fish. Lift. Drain well. Shredded - shredded. Set asideb. Bakepor Rice: Prepare a thick saucepan. Add rice, water, oil, bay leaves, pandan leaves, and salt. C. Cook over low heat while stirring. Lift.d. Add the basil leaves, shredded salted fish, chili and lime juice, stir well.e. Cover the pan then Cook on very low heat until cooking and cooked rice. Open the lid of the pan, leave it to the surface The rice looks dry and the edges crust. Turn off the flame. Sambal Raja: Fried long beans, eggplants and shallots briefly with hot oil. Drain.h. Ulek cayenne pepper, red chili, shrimp paste, salt and sugar. Give lemon juice. (Don't remove the orange peel, finely slice the orange peel). Saute the sauce until fragrant, add the long beans, eggplants and fried shallots earlier. Mix well before lifting enter sliced lime rind. Stir well. Turn off the fire. Sambal Raja is ready to be accompanied by Bakeporh rice. Presentation: Serve warm Bakepor Rice with Raja sambal

18. Papuan yellow broth



photo: Cookpad.com

Ingredients: - 500 gr fish, cut into pieces - 2 lime fruit - 2 bay leaves - 2 cm galangal, geprek - To taste cayenne pepper, leave intact - 2 lemongrass stems, geprek - 2 tomatoes, 2 pieces of 2 basil, siangi- 2 scallions, sliced- 500 ml water- To taste salt, sugar, flavoring (optional)
Smooth spices: - 8 grains of red onion - 5 grains of garlic - 3 cm of turmeric - 3 cm of ginger - 3 grains of hazelnut, roasted - 3 large red chilies (optional)
How to cook: a. Fish washed clean, I stole lemon juice. Mix a little salt. Stir well. Let stand 15 minutes. Wash again. B. Saute ground spices with lemongrass, galangal, and bay leaves, until fragrant. C. Add the fish and spring onions, stir thoroughly.d. Pour some water. Wait until the water boils. Add salt, sugar and flavoring. Stir well. Cook until the fish is perfectly cooked. Add the juice of lime juice, cayenne pepper, tomatoes, and basil leaves. Cook for a while. Lift.

19. Papuan baboto chicken typical



photo: Cookpad.com

Ingredients: - 250 grams of chicken fillet, finely chopped - 3 cloves of shallot - 2 cloves of garlic - 1/2 teaspoon walnuts that have been mashed (can be replaced with 1 piece of pecan roasted and puree) - 1 egg- 1 tablespoon thick coconut milk- 1/2 teaspoon salt- 1/4 teaspoon fine pepper- 1/4 teaspoon masako (can not use) - 1/8 teaspoon nutmeg- banana leaf sufficient to wrap the dough
How to cook: a. Mix all ingredients. stir until evenly mixed.b. Wrap with banana leaves. heat steaming water until boiling. then steam for 45 minutes on medium heat. cooked side, drain, and then ready to eat. Can be eaten with chips and sambal goang.
20. Papeda chicken egg Ingredients: - 1 egg chicken egg. - powdered broth and salt. - ground pepper. - 5 tablespoons of sago flour. - butter for spreading teflon. - 5 skewers. 5 tablespoons of vegetable water. / can skip.
How to cook: a. Beat the eggs with a little salt and ground pepper. Mix flour, water and salt, stir if it is too thick you can add more water. C. Turn on a low heat and place a 23 cm Teflon skillet on top, apply butter.d. Pour half a ladle of vegetable egg and shake briefly so that the egg does not clot. Add 1 tablespoon of vegetable flour mixture, if it dries slightly, sprinkle with powdered & chili broth, immediately roll with a skewer. Repeat until the batter runs out. Ready to serve with sauce or mayonnaise.

Reporter: Rizka Miftakhul
